this is a claim. It has not been verified by anything not based on the claim (ie by a non-circular argument). Also restoring some vandalised sentences.
the earliest canon was Marcion's. He was a gnostic, and his canon didn't include Mark, Matthew, or John. Thomas is usually thought very early, possible predating the gospels.
"sectarian" is biased compared to "sect"; and it is also a minority position that they predate Christianity - something that shouldn't be discussed here, but at [[gnosticism]]
rv sectarian means prejudiced towards a sect. They werent sectarian. They were a sect, and all gnostics were Christian.
